SEARCH
Module se1.bestellsystem
Package datamodel

Class DataFactory

Object
DataFactory
public class DataFactory extends Object
Factory class with create()-methods to instantiate objects of classes of the datamodel package from validated parameters. Objects are only created from valid parameters (e.g. names, email or phone contacts).
DataFactory itself exists as a ("lazy") singleton instance.
Version:
"C4-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
Author:
"sgraupner"

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DataFactory getInstance()
      Static accessor method to DataFactory Singleton instance.
      Returns:
      singleton DataFactory instance

    • createCustomer

      public Optional<Customer> createCustomer(String name, String contact)
      Factory method to create an object of class Customer from validated parameters. The id attribute is internally provided. No object is created when arguments are not valid.
      Parameters:
      name - single-String name parameter, invalid if null or empty, example: "Eric Meyer" or "Meyer, Eric"
      contact - contact parameter validated as an email address containing '@' or a phone number, invalid if null or empty
      Returns:
      created Customer object with valid parameters or empty

    • validateContact

      public Optional<String> validateContact(String contact)
      Validate contact for acceptable email address or phone number and return contact or empty result.
      The validation rule for an email address is defined by a regular expression: "^[a-z0-9._%+-]+@[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z0-9_]+$".
      The vaidation rule for an phone number is defined by: "^(phone:|fax:|\\+[0-9]+){0,1}\\s*[\\s0-9()][\\s0-9()-]*".
      Leading and traling whitespaces and quotes are trimmed from contact before validation.
      Parameters:
      contact - contact to validate
      Returns:
      possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) valid contact or empty result

    • validateName

      public Optional<String> validateName(String name, boolean acceptEmptyName)
      Validate name and return name or empty result. A valid name must start with a letter, followed by a combination of letters, "-", "." or white spaces. Valid names are: "E", "E.", "Eric", "Ulla-Nadine", "Eric Meyer", "von-Blumenfeld". Names do not include numbers or other special characters.
      The validation rule for a name is defined by a regular expression: "^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z-\\s.]*$". Leading and traling whitespaces and quotes are trimmed from name before validation.
      Parameters:
      name - name to validate
      acceptEmptyName - accept empty ("") name, e.g. as first name
      Returns:
      possibly modified (e.g. dequoted, trimmed) valid name or empty result

    • validateSplitName

      public Optional<DataFactory.NameParts> validateSplitName(String name)
      Split single-String name into first and last name parts and validate parts, e.g. "Meyer, Eric" is split into first: "Eric" and last name: "Meyer". Both parts are validated by method validateName(java.lang.String,boolean)().
      Parameters:
      name - single-String name
      Returns:
      record with validated first and last name parts
